cRqi6_cUSehWbdSVkXqYjg.text: Great new location of Harris Grill. This is going to be a great spot for the summer. Nice atmosphere, excellent drinks and perfect rooftop deck

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Frozen cosmo is amazing
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. New Harris Grill downtown Pittsburgh in old Tavern 245 location. Love the rooftop deck and the frozen cosmo is to die for.

LZRXhoOZJwvsw20SuJrnpg.text: This is probably one of the good rooftop restaurants I've been to, I was there for my birthday treat with a bunch of friends. It was an awesome place to hangout, waiter was very decent and humorous. Drinks were must to be tried and comments in the menu were so funny, we almost tried every drink on the menu  we enjoyed having fun with menu, this made us feel like we are waiting for the food, they are quick though. Food was very delicious, am in love with it. Would recommend visiting this place. Would go again!!

TRg9evhFGUfFNmpF_OJmpA.text: We had the most amazing date night here tonight. We sat at the bar while we waited for the roof seating to open up. It was worth the wait - beautiful and perfect weather. The mac&cheese was ridiculously delicious. The servers and hostess were wonderful and friendly. Great experience!

xgG7FETxmWuZBKcZvITIYQ.text: Fast and friendly service, tasty food, fun drinks, and a hilarious menu. Will definitely return.

NsPTY7GuUOZT7L1aja8NBQ.text: I found Harris Grill on yelp and even though it only had 5 reviews I decided to check it out. The wait staff was polite, prompt and accommodating. I sat on the roof top for lunch and enjoyed that as well. There were so many interesting choices but I was most excited about the Mac n Cheese. I enjoyed every bite and looked forward to going to Pittsburgh again and try something else!

y1dfIHnDjcXysyW1oDSODg.text: This place is amazing. The food is excellent, the prices are perfect (a little underpriced, in my opinion. The food is that good), and the service was great. From what I could see, it's clean. They do have outdoor seating on the second level with an awning and a bar which is perfect if the weather is right. I would drive to Pittsburgh from my home in Virginia JUST to eat here.

y0WTHNSS91fNItmN9kbj_A.text: This is a pretty good place for a Saturday with the homies. I got the "Henny Penny" which is a burger with this interesting spicy chicken breast. It was really good and around 13 bucks. I went with 6 of my friends and it was a good time.

y1xi12A9uoGXb2BoSMJjsg.text: Best place in town for Happy Hour. My coworkers and I go there regularly. You can't beat their happy hour prices. Love going there.

RnZr8UxLJTJP_um5imrnxg.text: If Harris Grill spent even half the time and effort on the food as they did the witty menu descriptions, it might be a decent brunch. $18 for a subpar drink of your choice, bitter coffee, unripe fruit bowl, and an underwhelming entree. The frozen mimosa is a terrible idea. The hollandaise on my eggs Benedict came out of a squirt bottle. Incredibly overpriced. Could've had much better bottomless mimosas and real eggs Benedict for cheaper somewhere else. Very disappointed in our experience as a whole. Will not return.

saOkM7Q704h9NqKlr1s3-Q.text: The Harris Grill has good food and a neat bar atmosphere. The service is wonderful, ask for Brittany .

fk6WuKC8VgTCjsqAPrwVMw.text: Stopped in looking for a place for lunch in the city, having been to the location in Shadyside several times and having positive experiences there I figured this would be the same thing. I was very disappointed. The portions were significantly smaller and the tater tots were soft and extremely greasy. Others in my party agreed that this location did not live up to Shadyside, will not be back for dinner, may be more appropriate for happy hour.

Oq_UrVnIibt_u4X0Oxabfg.text: It was my suggestion to go to Harris Grill Downtown with a group of old friends. The Shadyside location is really nice. I was so embarrassed for choosing this place. First they were out of almost every single bottled beer. Out of the draft I wanted. It was insane on a Saturday night to be out of everything at dinner time. The beverage manager needs to learn his/her job!! Then, the food came. I got the Delmonico steak sandwich. So grisly and over cooked it was terrible. The waitress was patient to put up with our complaining about being out of everything but it was horrible. I will never go back.

evIQRkMqbQ1KHjsM8PIWIw.text: We enjoyed a very nice and reasonably priced dinner here tonight. The service was excellent and everyone was super friendly and welcoming. The frozen cosmo was fantastic!!!! I highly recommend it. The salmon Cobb salad was a little small but delicious. My husband's Mac N Hamburger Helper was a large portion and very good too.

fHGZJCfO6Vl83d5bf48MvQ.text: This place might be one of my favorite spots in Pittsburgh. The vegetables were phenomenal and had such great flavor. The bacon cheeseburger had great flavor too. The atmosphere of the place was great the hostess was very friendly and it's a great place for groups.

VIMTMKEywSfBXCcaHZ38EA.text: It wasn't our first choice for lunch but we figured we'd give it a try since we'd seen good reviews. We were seated right away but that's where the good experience ended. It should've been a sign that the only other table seated before us had to get up and find someone to inquire about when their lunch would be ready. We finally order and after a ~20 minute wait 3 of our 4 lunches are served. I didn't get an explanation except mine would be ready "soon". The manager stops by and explains that the waitress forgot to enter my order but they were working on it and it would be out ASAP. When it was served it had onions (I asked for no onions), the turkey was kind of grey, the roll was hot and the turkey was frozen. I sent the sandwich back. The waitress came back to explain that it was a cold sandwich but they could heat it if I'd like. It wasn't cold - it was frozen -and the roll was hot. I sent it back for good while my friends finished their lunches. The best thing I can say is that they took it off the bill without asking.

2epulo2xErpQF9ghAkem0Q.text: Went there last night with my wife and sister and brother in law. The restaurant was near empty . Service was slow and the food was horrible. We complained and they took two meals off the bill.

dx59dXhiJf-Bk4lfFKbWqA.text: Our waiter was extremely rude didn't acknowledge us and had a very bad attitude. The food was ok. Will not be back

7YUcVwBYXgdTvImyLQ1kPQ.text: Fantastic!  Staff super friendly, and the food was absolutely incredible.  Had fish and jerk tacos, and the kids meals were healthy yet appealing.  Great atmosphere, can't say enough good things!  Definitely recommended to family in the area to go back.  Thank you for the great experience!

6S-AXiNet9mKz7ICnIBP-g.text: While visiting Pittsburgh, we came across this locals' favorite restaurant. Their food is made from scratch and is delicious. The spinach dip and pirogies were the best we have ever eaten. Just reading their creative menu listings is an enjoyable experience. Manager Doug Seng and server Jason Dow treat you like royalty. The prices are very affordable and the atmosphere is enchanting. If you get a chance to gogo!

LVWVrFj__C9c7PbAp21bZQ.text: The wife and I were looking for a nice spot to eat while checking out market square for the weekend of Christmas. I had read other reviews for some places near market square and surprisingly, there were not many good ones. Which is a good reason to write mine. We decided on the Harris grill. I must say, we were more than happy with the food, the drinks, the service. It was all excellent!! The food was spot on great. The waitress was very friendly, and even a manager asked how things were! And the pricing was great. 2 beers, 2 meals for around 40.00. We will make the Harris grill a regular stop while in the city. Great spot!

r_aMYf2O8R5iZ8RZLUz6FA.text: Was recently here one Sunday just to check it out since it replaced Tavern 245. It was devoid of customers and when I asked if they ever get busy, was told happy hour and lunch are their busiest times but other than that no.  One of their salads is delicious and what I ordered. It had candied roasted nuts, feta, some type of berry, and a sweet vinaigrette. I added salmon on top, and it was perfection and just what I was craving.  I liked it so much that I came back the next day to order it again! This time however, the salad wasn't that great. To be clear- the salmon on the salad wasn't that great. It was undercooked, and seemed to be old due to the grey tinge to the top of it (it wasn't the skin/scales not being properly taken off either). Thankfully they took the salmon charge off the salad (since I did eat the rest of it), and that was sincerely appreciated!  Rest assured, I will be back for a 3rd shot! Everyone has their off days :)

XEEZaT9s51lNGsUZwP0f0w.text: Nice choice of drinks. Love the atmosphere!! Be sure to take drinks to the roof top!!! Food and staff are great!

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Drink menu

UwJSEsrqJpkaEog9tbIANA.text: Drinks were ok. Waitress was sweet. Food was overly priced garbage. Wouldn't recommend!

aszuHXGeNUIjlC0CbeI_Fw.text: Central location, nice atmosphere and great menu of traditional food with a humorous/delicious spin.  Traveling for work and dining solo, I decided to stop in and sit at the bar.  I'll bullet point my dining experience below.   Ordered: Bourbon - Angels Envy (always awesome)  Tatertot nachos - Does this really need a follow up.  Exactly how it sounds with a vegetarian chile twist.   House salad - satisfying with the house balsamic being the highlight for me    Overall, the experience met all of my expectations, with the bartender Em, making it a 5 star experience. I recommend stopping by if you're in the area.

yCEkaBDXALFWOF-Q58ydXA.text: The ambiance at this place was awesome. Funky stuff up on the walls, snarky comments on the menus and checks, and our waiter was like, "This is Pittsburgh...of COURSE we have ranch for your chicken salad with fries." I had been talking Pittsburgh up all week with my work colleagues, and this place nailed it with what I had been telling them.  The food options were awesome, and I would definitely come back to try more of them, but I ended up with the mac & cheese, which the waiter told me won the city-wide competition. I always get worried when it's been broiled or baked that it will be too dry, but right underneath that crispy topping, was the creamiest, pepper-iest mac & cheese...I was very happy with it, and it wasn't too filling for a lunch option.

ULLRyd2NKCO0TB0ibaQBxw.text: Maddy, Sydney and Athena were exquisite! Their friendly attitude and fast service are what cinched my resolution to return... the food was paramount along with the decor as well. All in all I would highly recommend this establishment but more so this stellar crew!

I8XYBk3-mdhRDey5qPmIwA.text: I just looked at my Yelp bookmarks and realized that I never wrote a review for Harris Grill!

N_30C14Tyk5CfkeAUOsaKQ.text: Not really sure why the name is Harris Grill. This pace is your typical pub with ok food and drinks.

3Hb22BaFAZV6TSle2DFKUA.text: I LOVEEEEE Harris Grill! I have always visited the location in Shadyside but happened to be near the one Downtown; which is busier! The menu is pretty diverse with tasty options! I usually elect for the Delmonico sandwich which contains steaks, mushrooms (similar to a Philly) with fries! However, the menu had a limited time special - bacondouble chimichanga! Amazing! Pretty much a burger deep fried with chipotle sauce and fries! So out of the box but worth the risk to try! The servers are always friendly and they have happy hour specials between 4 and 6pm! They have macaroni and cheese with a twist - steak additions for example that taste phenomenal! Definitely a unique place to eat!

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

13cFiUX2Qfytpc6vrZHwUg.text: We were looking forward to the new location having enjoyed their other locations many times.  However, while the food was good, we were disappointed that smoking is allowed on the covered outdoor deck.  There were several tables of heavy smokers a few feet away and to be honest, we felt sick when left.  We won't be back as there are many options at nearby Market Square that do not allow smoking in their outside dining areas.  If you are a non-smoker, I would not recommend eating here - at least not on the deck.

r4mfi8MgVjtPpXXhGQZPMw.text: It's a small place and they didn't have a TV at the bar. They said they were getting one so I guess they just opened or just finished a renovation. The service at the bar was very friendly and everyone at the bar was having a great time. The food was very tasty and drinks were prepared well. I will definitely go back, but I hope they have a TV so we can watch whatever game is on.

p1nUTQyHGuDFbIPNHknoJg.text: We tried this place for a late dinner based on the positive reviews, but it didn't hold up to expectations largely due to the lack of service. We arrived more than 1/2 hr before the kitchen closed, were promptly greeted and seated. It was almost empty of customers. More than 15 min. later the server came by; we let him know we were getting drinks and were ready to order food. The server brought the drinks and left. After waiting for him to finally take our order, another 10 min. after that he returns to let us know they can't make the food item I ordered (out of ingredients) and then rushed me to choose something else immediately since the kitchen was supposed to be closed. The food was above-average, and the manager apologized about the food. The interactions with the server though was what took away from the experience.

EhqqjDMuxEQVbu_1mbvu2A.text: We decided to give this place a try thanks to its great Yelp reviews. It didn't disappoint. We took indoor seating because we were starving and didn't want to wait for the rooftop. The inside is really cool with lots of awesome artwork and a nice bar. I did the build your own bowl option, and my boyfriend got the steak sandwich. We split the calamari as app. All of the food was good, and I loved that I could customize my entree. The beer list was great, although they were out of our original choices. My only complaint is that the service was a little slow. Definitely a fun place to check out, though.

JOgASU5HpI_-9uH299nAhg.text: I love this place! Great rooftop area - downtown needed this near Market Square. The menu is uber creative and the cocktails are to die for! The perfect introduction of the Harris Grill restaurant family to the downtown area.

5paX63Fgn7pIp2EkNR_aQQ.text: Wow not sure how this place got 4 or 5 stars burger was ok fries were cold and limp. Bartender looked like a line cook and served like one as well. Looks like this place was opened on a beer budget. Won't be in business long the way the restaurant is operating.

Cpta9kQMsXk-EcImnOdcLA.text: This place is perfect for the post-work happy hour crowd. They do have some pretty good food, although I thought it was a little over priced for what I got.

DKb6YHGsUSJ9_X6-xmHCtA.text: A sister restaurant to Harris Grill Shadyside and Shiloh Grill on Mt. Washington, this is a very welcome addition to the downtown dining scene, as it has a great casual vibe that included a rooftop patio and really good unpretentious food at reasonable prices. The menu is extensive and includes a comic sense of humor throughout. In addition to appetizers, salads, entrees, burgers and sandwiches, there's several mac'n cheese dishes and a "build your own bowl" (of food) that can be a fun experience. There's even "church basement pierogies" on it! Service and decor is appropriately casual. The rooftop patio isn't gigantic and the view is cool, but not stunning, but nonetheless, it's awesome to have a rooftop patio at a casual restaurant in downtown as opposed to the urban rooftops with cocktails starting at $10.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. mac&#39;n cheese with lobster and crabmeat outdoor on the rooftop patio!

SYinqzWoaZ2-WCWcuJrRhA.text: Beautiful renovation on the former Tavern 245. Great comfort food with a menu similar to their sister restaurants. Menu descriptions are entertaining which is fun. Drinks are amazing, frozen cosmos is great on a summer day on their roof deck! Staff is attentive and welcoming.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Exterior

u1LtrxrVGvsLl61EvvPvQA.text: Came in after the Saint Patrick's Day Parade. Bartenders extremely accommodating and on-point! I am a germaphobe and all afternoon watching them and they are extremely thoughtful about sanitation.  Great spinach dip! Good beer selection.  Best choice this trip to Pittsburgh

qIqlJFK8ch09Bt3uJICsAw.text: The service was terrible, it was lunchtime downtown and it took us over an hour after we placed our order to get our food. The manager stopped by for a sec to "apologize" but didn't even offer to comp us for anything. Once our food finally arrived it was chewy, chewy chicken, chewy roasted vegetables, and a rock hard bun. I won't be going back anytime soon or ever.

tiYuSgYI7P_5kYKvTR_7rQ.text: With all due respect I did ask for a manager..... they never showed  In my experience in the hospitality field, good management knows when service is in the weeds and they are out, on the floor, mitigating the effect.  They are managing the impact, greeting guests..... keeping them happy.   A simple gesture of a drink or some chips to pass the time make it all better.  An hour to get a sandwich and a waitstaff that simply responds with, "it almost ready I think" is not how to succeed.

3LEGx_Cp5_i8TteR2t83-g.text: Came to Harris grill with some coworkers for a happy hour. We arrived at 4:15 which was before the happy hour at this location begins (4:30-6:30). The waitress was very accommodating and let us order some waters and wait, and promptly came back to our table at 4:30 to order (being on a budget I really appreciated this ). We split some appetizers and beer, and the happy hour prices really made it worth our while being half off drafts and 5 dollar appetizers. I was disappointed to learn the wings were taken off the happy hour menu though! I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Loaded tot-chos
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spinach dip

ZM1AfWVbDyMkRQ2mJwbotw.text: Shadyside location but I am boycotting them all. Not safe for POC.  Don't go here! My medium well burger was raw... then it came back burnt. It takes forever to get your food. And they falsify receipts by adding a merchant fee without telling you on the front end or at all (we checked our accounts)  Go somewhere else,  like Carmis. Js....

7sNgSfUExqYFUwJGzQOJrw.text: I've been to their sister location, Shiloh Grill, a few times but this was my first time checking out Harris Grill. I was really excited that a location opened up closer to where I live but also within walking distance of work. Both times I've ordered the same thing because I'm hooked and I don't want to mess with a good thing. What are the 2 things I'm hooked on you ask? Frozen cosmos and the trailer park totchos. I just had them yesterday and I'm already ready to go back and order some more. Their frozen cosmos are just $3.50 on Thursday's during happy hour 4:30-6:30! It's safe to say this might be my new happy hour spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

9jDb0cyMQv-wNL2tuUqFOw.text: I've never worked in the service industry but I figure it shouldn't be too hard not to charge my card twice.

tWgnOGzvcoePyb7MRvlbCw.text: Amazing Happy Hour!!! The first time that I came here was during lunch. We sat on the rooftop which was nice since it was covered. I wasn't too impressed with my hail! caesar salad which had mostly lettuce. However, I decided to give it another try and came here for happy hour. I am so glad that I did because now I have another great happy hour spot downtown! The happy hour is from 4:30-6:30 PM and there are specials for drinks and half off appetizers. I would definitely recommend the Spinach dip, it was seriously delicious! The dip is so flavorful and the pita was just perfect! I also got the buffalo wings which were really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spinach dip! Must try!!
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffalo wings with ranch
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Britney Spears

xxKVmdfXsuxLZQsZL6VsRA.text: Yes! Great prices for downtown what a refreshing change. Had the Delmonico A Go Go absolutely incredible sandwich and I'm not usually a sandwich fan. The peppers were just the right amount if flavor and heat to complement the deeeeeelish steak, crisped just right. The aioli wasn't overpowering but added that creamy garlic touch - I didn't even bother adding the side lettuce and tomato. Why confuse things? Yummmmmm couldn't even touch but one tater tot so I took those to go. All for $12.89 And then the delicious Grilz Pineapple mezcal based drink for $12 Boozy and the flavor of the mezcal came through nicely. The staff was so pleasant too. Thank you to my server Athina.  Sitting by myself at the bar I received just the right amount of attention. Keep the awesome price point and yummy food Harris Grill and I will remain a die hard fan.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The bar
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilz Pineapple yum
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Delmonico A Go Go with tots

5rJ-thHpllkp4jFdTICKmw.text: Yum! Deep fried cheeseburger, Mac n cheese and great beer selection. Great lazy Saturday hangout.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

A-2SILlaz0fi1CQvbdV25w.text: So for starters let me be clear: this applies to the downtown location only. I came here for happy hours after work initially and service was iffy. Drinks sub par and the overall atmosphere was just not anything special. Decent place for a quick drink for sure. Let's talk about food service. I try to be understanding and kind when it comes to servers and the food industry as a whole. But wow I have NEVER experienced a worse service than this restaurant. I came here for lunch on 3 separate occasions last year and was waiting for my order for AT LEAST 1 hour each time and it is not even that busy to be honest. One time it was 1 hour and 30 minutes (it was more busy). Luckily we had time to kill but totally unacceptable in theory. The Pittsburgh salad was not good and any other time I've eaten here the food has just been average. I haven't been back in a long time and have no desire to. The service is just so bad that you cannot even bother risking going here because it isn't that great anyway. the food is  not awful, but the service is so awful that you don't even want to come.

cGWAs5FbXTIG_DJltokdwg.text: Love all there locations & the staff is always great! Now that there's one downtown I order pick up on my breaks. I order there wings a lot & sometimes ask for all flats. I recently ordered wings & didn't even ask for flats even though I secretly wanted them lol. I got back to work & BOOM all flats baby!!  The fact that they catered to my needs without me asking is awesome. I was so happy! I also recieved the same treatment at their shadyside location. The bartender there sees me & without me asking brings me a frozen cosmo because that's my usual order. The staff is always friendly & goes above & beyond to accommodate my needs. I love all their locations & never have a problem. Definitely a favorite spot of mines.

q2bSwvjuiWw5AWZSnYuzZw.text: I'm a huge fan of the Harris Grill in Shadyside, so I was pleased to see a location downtown! They have a great covered outdoor patio area. Thank you for letting me sit outside but not have to roast in the sun! The menu is pretty identical to their other location, with perhaps a few updates. For bar food, it's a bit pricey, but comparable to many other places downtown with nice sized-portions.  We planned a little surprise lunch for a friend of mine and the staff did a great job with helping us pull it off. They had appetizer orders ready shortly after we arrived and our server, Brittany did an amazing job taking care of our whole party. The mac and cheese is always creamy and delicious-- it's really hard for me not to order it every single time. I also had the short-rib quesadilla which was very good!   If you visited here when it was Tavern 245, you know to expect a lot of steps, especially if you are venturing all the way up to the patio area!

cJDAG1SO47wsSv5Tn4Qnpg.text: Buffalo chicken is a huge no no here. It was more buffalo chicken soup than a dip. I ordered the tangerini cocktail and it was pretty bad to the point that my boyfriend and i left our table with the glass completely almost full. Service was alright but the buffalo chicken dip was maybe worth 3/4 dollars max. Don't order it!!

lldFhHJe1DjnbygDAljG_g.text: Really nice dinner out!  Was dining with my husband and son and was seated on roof after our server Justin noticed my son was uncomfortable with the noise level on the main level.  This endeared me quickly to Harris Grill as my son has autism and loud environments can be tough for him.    Now we were primed for a nice dinner after seeing the sites of Pittsburgh.    The menu descriptions were creative and made it hard to pick what to order...so much sounded good.   I am from DC so never see pierogies on menus so tried that so good.   My son said the burger was perfect.  Also good selections of beer and wine.  Dessert also good!  What made our night was the friendly service from Justin, he is terrific waiter.   Wish I lived closer or I would be back often.

7SeoXokneKWk6jR-qv5elw.text: Easy this is one of my fave spots downtown. They have all the makings for a good time...excellent service, great food, nice environment with a rooftop option and that frozen cosmo is amazing.   On to the food...The calamari app was huge and featured lightly breaded and crispy squid morsels. The sweet and slightly spicy thai sauce was delicious.  We ordered the sauce on the side but after tasting it, I could've rolled around in the stuff....it was good. Steak sandwich arrived with fresh condiments on the side. The steak was tender and seasoned very well under the large ciabatta like bun....yum! The crabcake sammie was good too and had minimal filler. I would've enjoyed just a bit more filler to keep it all together but that didn't impact the flavor or quality one but. Mac and cheese is rightous...that stuff is creamy and cheese covered and filled every noodle...yes! The tater totties were crispy, salty (in a good way) and crunchy. They were your average tots and was a nice flavor and texture contrast from the soft crabcake.   The frozen cosmo...mannnnn, can I get a "what , what....?" This cute little pink drink came out and after one sip, I knew they meant business. Fresh, slightly sweet and strong which makes it the perfect wind down to the evening.   It was a wonderful experience and I can't wait to go back!!!

U2g8tLWFpq9aowCwCckWtQ.text: Unfortunately downtown Harris Grill is not even a good bar food joint. Dried out chicken, no ice tea, uninspired ... if you're going to serve workers downtown we would like a little variety and better quality... it's just a bar now.

-X_MdCK3uBRTiVUoqsXzJw.text: I love this place. Funny thing is I can't remember exactly what sandwich I had. It was either the burger or the grilled chicken. All I remember is that it was extremely delicious. The reason I can't remember was because I was overwhelmed with pleasure when I sunk my teeth into the side of Mac n Cheese. Besides that whatever sandwich I had my friend had the other and we both insisted sharing bites. Yum yum yum when can I go back and get me some !!!!

4FfOhttMr1MG7UEv5nr88Q.text: I was so excited for it to be a Friday night and treat myself to Harris Grill. I ordered via grub hub and the food was cold and pretty bland.   We ordered the Mac and cheese, beef quesadillas, tatchos and the Henny Penny (chicken sandwich). Overall, it was "okay". It was extremely frustrating to pay over $60 in takeout and have to put everything in the microwave because it was so cold. The driver was nice and arrived on time so I'm not sure how long our food sat around until it was delivered.

opk3ZrCCaQcZo25FCm91Kg.text: Absolutely great. I loved the food. Their fries are to die for. Whatever they put on them made them so yummy. The server was also wonderful. Overall just a super cool. If you ever come here ask for Sam. She's wonderful. They were especially wonderful with my one year old. I can't wait to come back.

9S0hUgWilkRVVY_ZzsWFLQ.text: Saturday afternoon of St Pat's weekend in Pittsburgh and we stumbled upon the Harris Grill when looking for somewhere to celebrate and we had a fun time!  We got seated right away in their bar area and they had tons of specials going on for the day.  We ordered some drinks and some food and settled in to have fun with the other patrons.  Our food was delicious - I got the fish and chips and my husband a burger.  We did start with their artichoke dip to accompany the drinks.  Not a bad bite of food!  Our waitress was very outgoing, kept our drinks flowing and the conversation.

RdGRryqtsjQC2u4Quwx4vQ.text: This review is a little belated (we were there in early February of this year).  We had a large group coming in from out of town (~20 people), looking for last minute accommodations for a large party on a Saturday night.  There weren't a lot of options but Harris was able to accommodate our party.  It was a bit of a walk from where we were staying, but we didn't have many options.  This turned out to be very fortunate.  First, let me start by thanking our server, Amber (and the other person who was assisting given the size of the party), who were absolutely awesome.  As we had several small groups (meaning several different checks), sat at different tables (so kids could sit with kids), etc.  I'm sure it would have normally been an accounting nightmare, but she was totally on top of it and was by so frequently nobody was ever waiting for a refill, request or otherwise.  Second, the food was great.  The menu is fun and everyone enjoyed what they got.  I had the lobster mac & cheese, phenomenal if your diet allows for it.  It also had a nice beer selection.  We had such a great experience that should we be in town again, this will be the first place I call to attempt to make a reservation.  Thanks again everyone there that night from the staff to the kitchen, you guys were great.

7NaX8QU955B8mzcMyK3J1Q.text: I really had a great time at Harris Grill. I did not realize that they opened a new spot downtown after the Shadyside location burnt down or maybe this was already here? I don't really keep up on things like that but after working downtown for a bit now I stumbled upon them!   I am pleased that the menu stayed the same. The food as always is very good. I came with a large work party and we were able to score a seat on the balcony in the third floor. Bathrooms are on the 2nd floor so just be prepared for that.  Our party ordered, I believe everything on the apps page and then individual dinners. I just went with the wings after eating that many apps.   My favorite app was the spinach dip and the skillet mac and cheese. Both were very good. The mac and cheese had a nice crisp top and very cheesy, no watered down barely cheesed noodles here! The spinach dip was packed full of flavor and the warm pita chips were divine.  I got two orders of wings. 1. The garlic parm wings and the 2. Chimichurri wings. I liked both. But I will say I think maybe the chimichurri wings were a bit hotter than I expected. It was either them or the one mild wing I tried but my lips were burning! Wowwie. Now all the wings were good, but man, I was not expecting that flavor punch.  This was a fun spot to hang at. I look forward to coming here again.

EqAKJeS2d-laZTmBG6W2hw.text: I wanted to like it more than I did. I think I liked the Shadyside location better but haven't been there in years. Definitely bar atmosphere and food. Enter and head up the stairs for the Harris Grille as Tinsel Town is on the lower level. The menu is super cool with lots of fun names and descriptions for food which makes it unique. Vegetarian/pescatarian friendly for those who don't eat meat. We were seated immediately even on a busy Saturday night as this is a little away from the main Market Square action. Cleanliness of the restaurant seemed average and this is not a new place.   The buffalo cauliflower wings had good taste but were pretty greasy compared to others I've had has the breading did not seem to be staying on. The fish tacos were okay but I'd probably try something else when I come back. Vegetarian chili was definitely good and I'd get it again, but it's definitely not very spicy.   Average place with average meal. The coolest thing is the menu but my food didn't live up to my expectations unfortunately. Don't get me wrong, definitely not bad and I would come back so if you're in Market Square and need a place to grab food without a long wait, check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fish tacos, side of veggie chili and grilled veggies
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Black and blue burger

EjffEagyAlxKUirELBERMA.text: Food was ok. We had hummus appetizer which was plain no seasoning, lemon juice, salt, etc. (plain garbanzo beans in a food processor). I had a grilled vegetable sandwich, but the ones in our hometown are better. The grilled vegetable/quinoa bowl my husband had looked very good.  Service was great. You have to climb two flights of stairs to get to the restaurant on the 2nd floor. Noise level was high.

fYT5o0L0dzQh7d0oz3M7-A.text: Things I love about Harris Grill: Happy hour pricing. Frozen Cosmo's with an extra floater Outdoor seating. Friendly staff.  Things I do not love: Food is .. meh? It's very very very small, which I understand they can't exactly help due to the location etc. The lack of quality control or standardization in things, we all ordered frozen cosmo's, five of us. Some came in a martini glass, some came in a rocks glass, one came half filled in a pint glass. We laughed about it, but it was little odd. At least standardize what you serve one table.   I like this place, and it's always a good place to pop in for one or two drinks to waste time before heading home. I'd be curious to pop in for lunch.

OB-exE_ECMgI10TLuR1otg.text: I visited last summer when the downtown location first opened and wasn't impressed. I thought since that was a year ago maybe things changed. Unfortunately they didn't.   I visited on a Sunday. They only had the breakfast buffet taking place. We weren't aware of it until we were already seated and our server came over (which was about 10 minutes into our visit.)The buffet use to include eggs make to order. Our server informed us it no longer did. I was pretty disappointed because it's the same cost as when that was included. The buffet does include one alcoholic beverage - a frozen mimosa or a Bloody Mary. I always get the frozen mimosa.   We get up to the buffet and it's basically empty. The food that is there does not look fresh at all. The space isn't very large and it wasn't crowded so I'm not sure why the food wasn't maintained better. After sitting down we came to find out some of the food was also cold.   I can't imagine I'll be stopping again. I really love the Harris Grill in Shadyside, I just think this one is underwhelming.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

lq86ZZjvhyZ1h-NU2NIeVg.text: Our bartender, Haley, was so much fun! Made us feel at home and so comfortable.  Already planning our next visit! Thanks for making us feel at home!

AzoOKKHbgVYSL0INchbO9w.text: I just looked at my Yelp bookmarks and realized that I never wrote a review for Harris Grill!    My fiance and I dined here with a couple of our friends a few months back and we had a great time!  We weren't expecting much at first because the building is a little non-descript and the restaurant is upstairs.  When we arrived we were the only ones there and we weren't 100% sure they were even open.  We saw an employee and she seated us right away and confirmed that we could get our lunch on!  The menu is quite expansive.  They have so many delicious items to choose from.  They also have an excellent cocktail menu.  We were all so excited about the wide variety.    I went with the Henny Penny and it was delicious.  Everyone really enjoyed their food.  The service was a little slow but also very good.  We also really loved the quirky interior.  Harris Grill is a cool space and has so many offerings for everyone.  I would definitely return if ever in the area again!

t22YIcERwIU9afCFd4RcXA.text: Stumbled upon this gem while visiting Pittsburgh. Most other restaurants in the area seemed overpriced with underwhelming menus. First the staff was amazing. The atmosphere was very cool, we hung out on the rooftop patio. Beer selection was good and food was amazing. The wife had a few delicious cocktails and left wishing she could try more of their unique concoctions. We ate the Mac and cheese, and the steak sandwich, food was just as great as the other things listed. If you're not into fine dining and dark romantic spots then this one may be worth a try.

AtCf_m0zsCRvs1BVuLTNXg.text: Love love loved this place.  It looks cute from the outside and has lots of outdoor seating.  The food is good and the staff is friendly.  It reminds me of one of my favorite places back home.  I would recommend.  Perfect bar/restaurant spot.

8L83Q0k22Scvw49UvesqyA.text: This is the third of the chain of Harris grill I visited. The other two are in Shadyside  and Mt. Washington. Upon entry you go up a flight of stairs to the restaurant level. Inside there are booths that span the middle of the restaurant as well as along the side that run parallel to the main bar area.  There are also TVs for your enjoyment. The menu is pretty similar to the other two restaurants. My husband ordered a chicken Caesar salad and I ordered a roasted vegetable salad. Since we arrived early we got our food fairly quickly. I liked how the vegetable tasted and included beets. My husband told me his chicken was hard to cut at the beginning but for the most part was fairly tender.  Our waitress looked after us and was very attentive to our needs.  I don't frequent downtown that often due to parking but on free holiday Sats it gave us a chance to get away from all the holiday crowds around Market Square and still have a descent lunch.  Located on 4th Ave near Wood St, it is definitely worth a visit if you willing to spend a little extra for lunch but not go overboard.

photos.caption: Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Roasted veggies salad
Photo of Harris Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Caesar salad

eKR0JefUwmg8YoYORaXk0g.text: Really good quality product and service here.  The staff and management are always looking out for their customers and making sure everyone has a positive experience.  They even go as far to make sure you don't over-consume.  The food and beer selection is great, along with the decor.  Thank you

OkR508Np82TO5O5AVwC26g.text: I really want to like Harris Grill. I've been a few times and each time I've left underwhelmed. Any time someone suggests going here, my reaction is always 'meh'. Their food is over priced for what you get and their menu doesn't make sense. I feel like this place is trying really hard to be something but it's missing the mark.   I enjoyed their wings but they're not spectacular and I only got 5. Um. What. They should tell you not to get that as an entree, btw. I really disliked their Huevos Ranchos as it was absolutely way too spicy.  The brunch special is $18 when you get ONE drink and then your meal. I could go elsewhere and get bottomless brunch drinks for $18 and better food. And their service is really something to be desired. Anyway, their Mac and cheese is good, though. If you go here, stick with that.

RtTWumYJruEcnB4cQlVTYQ.text: The food was very good! The whole place has a fun decor. The happy hour is excellent. There's an extensive beer selection. We had spinach and artichoke dip and it was so good. We also had one of the best waitresses I've ever had. When there's excellent staff I will always return. The only thing I would say is the women's restroom could've been cleaner.

eG6X7Su3-nFwtHK3OnRLsA.text: I really like this location. My heart will always belong to Shadyside but since I work downtown having Harris here is like having Shadyside's twin sister.  I can get all of my favorites at lunchtime. And even now and again sneak in a cocktail during the luncheon hour. The food is always perfect and so is the staff. Seriously!

m04ljkyNOtN7u9dP20g6tA.text: I've been here before and liked it. I had lunch with a friend there today. She had the salmon Cobb salad and I had the Pittsburgh chicken salad. They both tasted good but the portions were small- much smaller than I remembered from previous trips. I wasn't full. The service was good though. I'm hoping it was just a fluke.

ZVn2PWfDy3ihdh75ujSSvA.text: If you go anytime through the week, the bar on the second floor will be where you go. The first floor bar is only open weekends.   Same menu as the other Harris Grills in Shadyside and Mount Washington.   The food is always good, the kitchen got my Friend's order wrong, he asked for fries with his Black & Blue burger and got tots, he wasn't upset, he got to eat both. A quick trip to the kitchen and the bartender came out with a bowl of fries. Tots, fries, and a black & blue burger? Life is good.   If you can't do steps to get to the second or third floors (ie wheelchairs, crutches, etc) you're out of luck unless it's the weekend.

Ot1yhLzWyS7UzmJUHihOIg.text: I used to be a fan of Harris Grill. They have a great happy hour and a nice outside balcony. This was until I tried their brunch. It is a buffet style. Everything was cold and it was not being actively refilled.

q7W9-XYo9L1u9cSfaD_ZHw.text: Big portions of food. Friendly staff. Wide variety of dietarily-accommodating comfort food. Knowledgeable bartender and wide variety of drinks.
